posts.post_content:
I guess holgir found a possible reason why this card's activation cost even includes discarding.  
But i still don't get why Wizards did not want to make this card more interesting then if it was intended to find use with *Uneath* creatures.  
Especially when regarding the generous memorable name which mirrors the creature types this card has. and it actually has an interesting flavor, too - it's the only red skeleton yet.  
  
For ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) this tiny 2/1 body could have easily gained regeneration for ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) or just by discarding a card only - and in case they didn't like having regeneration in a monored deck, they could have added "Use this ability only if you control a Swamp."  
With both the latter activation cost and a mana cost of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) this could even have become an interesting choice for Madness decks. Like this, it's just unplayable junk and drafting material for desperate plans.  
  
See, i actually like the artwork and flavor text of this card and i'd really like playing it if it looked like t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

But i still don't get why Wizards did not want to make this card more interesting then if it was intended to find use with Uneath creatures.
Especially when regarding the generous memorable name which mirrors the creature types this card has. and it actually has an interesting flavor, too - it's the only red skeleton yet.

For this tiny 2/1 body could have easily gained regeneration for or just by discarding a card only - and in case they didn't like having regeneration in a monored deck, they could have added "Use this ability only if you control a Swamp."
With both the latter activation cost and a mana cost of this could even have become an interesting choice for Madness decks. Like this, it's just unplayable junk and drafting material for desperate plans.

posts.post_content:
[Vulshok Berserker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vulshok Berserker) is a good way to spend your red mana if you want a 4-drop. [Smallpox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smallpox), [Merfolk Looter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk Looter), etc are great ways to pitch cards if you need a discard outlet. If you want a 2/1 body, [Goblin Piker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Piker) is magnificently cheap and even synergizes with the entire Goblin and Warrior tribe. If you want a regenerator, [Drudge Skeletons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drudge Skeletons) does the job. If you want a red card that gives you a black regenerator, [Skeletonize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skeletonize) also counts as removal and is instant.  
  
This card is a depressing incentive to *not play limited*.
posts.html:
Vulshok Berserker is a good way to spend your red mana if you want a 4-drop. Smallpox, Merfolk Looter, etc are great ways to pitch cards if you need a discard outlet. If you want a 2/1 body, Goblin Piker is magnificently cheap and even synergizes with the entire Goblin and Warrior tribe. If you want a regenerator, Drudge Skeletons does the job. If you want a red card that gives you a black regenerator, Skeletonize also counts as removal and is instant.

This card is a depressing incentive to not play limited.
